item.title: Backup and Restore PostgreSQL Database on CentOS 7
item.description: Databases are crucial components of many systems and software. Thus, knowing how to backup and restore them becomes an essential skill. This article will guide you through the process of backing up and restoring a database in PostgreSQL on a CentOS 7 system. Backup The first step is to backup the database. In PostgreSQL, you can use the pg_dump command to achieve this. Here’s an example of using this command:
